results.title: Marilyn Monroe: beyond the legend
results.brief_description: This documentary narrated by Richard Widmark, is a tribute to the legendary actress. Numerous film clips range from her earliest appearances in “Dangerous Years” and “All About Eve”, to her triumphant performance in “Bus Stop” and “The Misfits”. The film also features a wealth of rare archival and newsreel footage, as well as in depth interviews with colleagues and friends.

results.title: Marijuana: the great escape
results.creator_credit: Bailey Film Productions and J. Gary Mitchell
results.brief_description: A discussion of the effects of marijuana and the forces acting to encourage the use the drugs amongst young people. Focuses on George whose major interest in drag racing and a girl named Pat. He is successful as a racer and his relationship with Pat is a happy one. George uses marijuana regularly and tries to persuade Pat to become a user. Their experiences provide a useful starting point for the discussion.

results.title: Marijuana
results.brief_description: Here, a somnolent Sonny Bono appears as the friendly face of commercial interests. This document is one of a series of reactionary films against drug use and the toning down of 1960’s youth culture. A dramatised examination of the “facts” relating to marijuana. Contrasts the use of marijuana, alcohol and other drugs. Points out that some people can develop a psychological dependence, and that the laws of the country are designed to protect both the individual and the society. [Ignores established and medical fact that cannabis was freely grown and consumed, and indeed providing the principle source of paper pulp in the U.S. until the Harris Narcotics Act of 1937]. Music by Gene Clarke.

results.title: Marigoli
results.creator_credit: University of California, Los Angeles and Sandra Nichols
results.brief_description: Looks at Marigoli, a village area of equatorial Africa, and the problems caused by a rapidly expanding population. There is reluctance by the women to use birth control, because of the expectancy of a high mortality rate amongst their children. Food was once plentiful, but is now scarce due to the rapid expansion of population and the reduction of arable land. Also looks at the expense of education for children.

results.title: Marie Antoinette, Reine de France = Marie Antoinette, Queen of France
results.brief_description:
Cast of 1000s extravaganza recounting the last days of the French monarchy and Queen Marie Antoinette’s affair with dashing Swedish ambassador, Axel Fersen.

Credits: Director, Jean Delannoy ; writers, Bernard Zimmer, Jean Delannoy, Philippe Erlanger ; photography, Pierre Montazel ; music, Jacques Simonot.
Cast: Michele Morgan, Richard Todd, Jacques Morel.

results.title: Marie
results.creator_credit: Southern Cross Films and Douglas Hardy
results.brief_description: Story of the meeting of an Australian man and a migrant girl called Marie from post war Europe. A commentary is given from the man’s point of view on their conversations with her recollections of life in Europe, her regret at her mother not seeing her life in Australia, and her lack of taking her life for granted. Takes place on Sydney harbour in a sailboat race setting. Uses the race and her growing love for the harbour as a metaphor for Australia’s pro-migration program.

results.title: Maria of the Pueblos
results.brief_description: Centres on the life of Maria Martinez, who is probably the world’s most successful Indian potter. Tells how Maria accidentally rediscovered the secret of recreating iridescent black pottery, and unselfishly shard it to life her village out of poverty.

results.title: Maria going home
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Debby Kingsland and Tom Manefield
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Maria, originally from Spain, has been in Australia some fifteen years - half her life. In the film she and her family discuss plans to return to Spain. The film is intended to show why a family, materially and professionally successful in Australia and with two Australian born children might choose to uproot themselves a second time.
